channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Data-Center Owners Get an Edge Over Big Tech Tenants, Finally
item.description: An artificial-intelligence land grab is lifting shares of the centers’ landlords, such as Equinix, after years of mediocre rent growth.

item.title: Cava earnings beat estimates as restaurant traffic climbs nearly 10%
item.description: The Mediterranean restaurant chain Cava said its fiscal second-quarter traffic climbed 9.5%, bucking industry trends.

item.title: A Time-Honored Strategy Puts Your Retirement at Risk of Financial Ruin
item.description: The tried-and-true 60/40 portfolio and 4% withdrawal rate in retirement could lead to “catastrophic” outcomes if markets behave differently than in th...

item.title: Peloton shares soar 35% as turnaround plan takes hold, losses shrink
item.description: Peloton has been working to generate free cash flow and return to profitability, and has made cuts to sales and marketing budgets to improve its balan...

item.title: Nvidia Is Up 2,000% Since 2019. These WSJ Readers Invested Early.
item.description: Eight investors share why they bought the chip maker’s stock—and how much they have made.

item.title: Bavarian Nordic shares pop over 13% on earnings beat, bumper mpox vaccine order
item.description: Shares of Danish biotech company Bavarian Nordic jumped Thursday after reporting first-half earnings and a bumper mpox vaccine order.

item.title: The New Etiquette of Negotiating With Your Real-Estate Agent
item.description: What buyers should look out for in agent agreements.

item.title: Amazon's cloud unit may need to pass the profit growth baton to e-commerce
item.description: Amazon's retail business has "big shoes to fill," according to one Wall Street research firm.

item.title: Engine Shortages Have Grounded Airlines. This Company Has the Formula to Fix That.
item.description: Being a one-stop shop for leasing, repairs and parts has made FTAI one of the commercial-aviation industry’s few bright spots.

item.title: Target shares spike as profits rise, despite cautious sales outlook
item.description: The discounter's sales rose as shoppers made more visits to Target's stores and website.
